methods.label: add
methods.comment: Adds an element to the container
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code will print &quot;Error adding&quot; for the first Try/Catch. But for the second, the error will be suppressed and the call to .add() will return False
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim success as Boolean
Try
    success = coll.add(2)
    Print success    &apos; Code will not get to this line
Catch
    Print &quot;Error adding&quot;   &apos; This will be printed
End Try
success = coll.add(&quot;2&quot;)
Print success    &apos; Code will print False

methods.label: addAll
methods.comment: Adds all elements from an array or source Collection to the current Collection.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code creates a collection of scalars containing &quot;One&quot; and 2. It sets suppressErrors on the second collection, then adds the first collection to the second. This adds any strings to the second collection (i.e. &quot;One&quot;), while suppressing errors from any non-String entries (i.e. 2). The second collection contains one element, the string &quot;One&quot;.
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;SCALAR&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim coll2 as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.add(2)
coll2.suppressErrors = True
Call coll2.addAll(coll)

methods.label: contains
methods.comment: Checks whether the Collection contains a specific value. Requires a valid Comparator to compare each element.
methods.codesample:
%REM
Although no explicit comparator is passed into this Collection, an instance of the default Comparator class is used. This works for scalars, by comparing the datatype (treating all numerics as the same datatype) and then CStr-ing the value.
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;SCALAR&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.add(2)
Print coll.contains(1)   &apos; Prints False
Print coll.contains(2)   &apos; Prints True

methods.label: filter
methods.comment: Filters a collection using a CollectionFilter and returns a new &quot;filtered&quot; collection
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code shows how to create a filter for even numbers and use it. The code is very basic with no error handling.
%END REM
Class EvenFilterer as CollectionFilter
    Function filter(source as Variant) as Boolean
        If (source Mod 2 = 0) Then Return True
    End Function
End Class
Dim coll1 as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim coll2 as Collection
Dim filterer as New EvenFilterer()
&apos; Populating collection omitted
Set coll2 = coll1.filter(filterer)

methods.label: getAndRemoveFirstRaw
methods.comment:
Returns the FIRST element in the collection and removes it from the collection.
If the collection is empty it just exits the function
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code builds a FIFO queue, printing the entries from the collection
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.add(&quot;Two&quot;)
Print CStr(coll.getAndRemoveFirstRaw())    &apos;Prints One
Print CStr(coll.getAndRemoveFirstRaw())    &apos;Prints Two
Print coll.hasContent    &apos;Prints False

methods.label: getIndex
methods.comment: Checks whether the Collection contains a specific value.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code creates a Collection of strings. This will print &quot;Contains One&quot; and &quot;Does not contain Two&quot;.
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
If (Not IsNull(coll.getIndex(&quot;One&quot;)) Then Print &quot;Contains One&quot;
If (IsNull(coll.getIndex(&quot;Two&quot;)) Then Print &quot;Does not contain Two&quot;

methods.label: getNthElementRaw
methods.comment: Gets the nth elment as a raew variant, starting at index 0

%REM
The following code gets the element at index 1. It then checks an entry at index 2, which returns that it is empty
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.add(&quot;Two&quot;)
Print CStr(coll.getNthElementRaw(1))    &apos; Prints &quot;Two&quot;
Print IsEmpty(coll.getNthElementRaw(5))     &apos; Prints True

methods.label: insertAt
methods.comment: Inserts an element in the collection at an index, starting at index 0. Not allowed for sorted collections
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is abbreviated code from Collection.getIndex. It compares each element against the value being checked, and if it matches, returns the current index.
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim testSuite as New TestSuite(&quot;Validate collections&quot;)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.add(&quot;Two&quot;)
Call coll.insertAt(&quot;Three&quot;, 1)
Call testSuite.describe(&quot;Check 3 elements&quot;).assertEqualsLong(3, coll.elementCount)
Call testSuite.describe(&quot;Check second element is Three&quot;).assertEqualsString(&quot;Three&quot;, CStr(coll.getNthElementRaw(1), True)
Call testSuite.describe(&quot;Check third element is Two&quot;).assertEqualsString(&quot;Two&quot;, CStr(coll.getNthElementRaw(2), True)
Dim coll1 as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, True)    &apos; Sorted
Call coll1.addAll(coll)
Call testSuite.describe(&quot;Test adding to sorted collection&quot;)
Try
    Call coll.insertAt(&quot;Three&quot;, 1)
    Call testSuite.addResult(False, &quot;Successfully inserted into sorted collection, this should have errored&quot;)
Catch
    Call testSuite.addResult(True, &quot;&quot;)
End Try

methods.label: join
methods.comment: Joins a collection of scalar values into a single string response separated by a passed delimiter
methods.codesample:
Dim coll as New Collection(INTEGER, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(1)
Call coll.add(2)
Print coll.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos; Prints &quot;1,2&quot;
Set coll = new Collection(PERSON, Nothing, False, False)    &apos; Assumes a Person class available
Dim p1 as New Person
Dim p2 as New Person
Call coll.add(p1)
Call coll.add(p2)
Print coll.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos; Prints &quot;NOT STRINGABLE,NOT STRINGABLE&quot;

methods.label: remove
methods.comment: Removes an element (or elements, if not unique) from the Collection. Returns the number of elements removed.
methods.codesample:
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(1)
Call coll.add(2)
Call coll.add(2)
Call coll.add(6)
Call coll.add(2)
Print coll.remove(2, False)   &apos;Prints 1

methods.label: replace
methods.comment:
Replaces an element with another and returns the number of replacements made.
If the Collection is unsorted, replacements are made at the same positions.
If the Collection is sorted, the old elements are removed and new ones inserted at the appropriate sorted location.
methods.codesample:
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(1)
Call coll.add(2)
Call coll.add(6)
Call coll.add(1)
Call coll.replace(1, 3, True)
Print coll.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos;Prints 3,2,6,3
Dim coll1 as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, True)
Call coll1.add(1)
Call coll1.add(2)
Call coll1.add(6)
Call coll1.add(1)
Call coll1.replace(1, 3, True)
Print coll1.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos;Prints 2,3,3,6

methods.label: toJson
methods.comment:
Converts the Collection to a JsonObject that&apos;s an array.
If the array values are objects, the code will try to call a toJson method on the object, otherwise skip them.
methods.codesample:
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim jsonObj as JsonObject
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.add(&quot;Two&quot;)
Set jsonObj = coll.toJson()
Print jsonObj.toString(False)    &apos;Prints [&quot;One&quot;,&quot;Two&quot;]

methods.label: suppressErrors
methods.comment:
Suppress errors on adding elements. Errors wll still be thrown if the Collection is locked
or attempting to insert an entry into a sorted Collection.
Instead of throwing an error, e.g. for wrong content type, the method will just return false
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code will print &quot;Error adding&quot; for the first Try/Catch. But for the second, the error will be suppressed and the call to .add() will return False
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim success as Boolean
Try
    success = coll.add(2)
    Print success    &apos; Code will not get to this line
Catch
    Print &quot;Error adding&quot;   &apos; This will be printed
End Try
coll.suppressErrors = True
Try
    success = coll.add(2)
    Print success    &apos; Code will print False
Catch
    Print &quot;Error adding&quot;   &apos; This will NOT be printed
End Try

		Useful when passing a collection to other functions.
methods.codesample:

Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.lock()
Call coll.add(&quot;Two&quot;)   &apos; Throws error

Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)

methods.label: transform
methods.comment: Transforms members of this Collection using a CollectionTransformer and adds them to the new Collection passed
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code shows how to create a transformer to square values. The code is very basic with no error handling.
%END REM
Class SquareTransformer as CollectionTransformer
    Function transform(source as Variant) as Variant
        transform = source * source
    End Function
End Class
Dim coll1 as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim coll2 as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim transformer as New SquareTransformer()
Call coll1.add(2)
Call coll1.add(3)
Call coll1.add(4)
Call coll1.transform(transformer, coll2)
Print coll2.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos; Prints 4,9,16

methods.label: unlock
methods.comment: Unlocks the Collection, so add, remove, replace or reverse functions can be used again
methods.codesample:
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.lock()
Try
    Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Catch
    &apos; Code will enter this catch block
End Try
Call coll.unlock()
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)   &apos; This will be successful

classes.comment: Class to transform elements in a Collection to something else
classes.codesample:
%REM
The following code shows how to create a transformer to convert scalars to doubles. The code is very basic with no error handling.
%END REM
Class DoubleTransformer as CollectionTransformer
    Function transform(source as Variant) as Variant
        If (IsNumeric(source)) Then
            If (Not TypeName(source) = &quot;BOOLEAN&quot; And Not IsDate(source)) Then
                transform = CDbl(source)
            End If
        End If
    End Function
End Class

Dim coll1 as New Collection(&quot;SCALAR&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim coll2 as New Collection(&quot;DOUBLE&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim transformer as New DoubleTransformer()

&apos; Populating collection omitted

Call coll1.transform(transformer, coll2)

methods.label: compare
methods.comment: Main function that does the comparison. Only needs to code for natural before/after. The outer function will reverse the result if the Comparator is instantiated as descending order or Collection has been reversed.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is Comparator.compareAscDesc.
%END REM
Public Function compareAscDesc(source as Variant, target as Variant, collReversed as Boolean) as Integer
    compareAscDesc = compare(source, target)
    If (m_isDescending Xor collreversed) Then Return 0 - compareAscDesc Else Return compareAscDesc
End Function

methods.label: compareAscDesc
methods.comment:
Compares source and target, returning -1 if source is before target, 0 if they are the same, 1 if source is after target.
The value is reversed (so -1 changed to 1, 1 changed to -1) if:
- Comparator is descending, but Collection is not reversed
- Comparator is ascending, but Collection is reversed
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is abbreviated code from Collection.getIndex. It compares each element against the value being checked, and if it matches, returns the current index.
%END REM
Public Function getIndex(checkValue as Variant) as Variant
    ForAll elem in Me.p_content)
        If (Me.Comparator.compareAscDesc(checkValue, elem, Me.p_isCollReversed) = 0) Then Return ListTag(elem)
    End ForAll
End Function

It compares each element against the value being checked, and if it matches, returns the current index.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Public Function getIndex(checkValue as Variant) as Variant&lt;br /&gt;    ForAll elem in Me.p_content)&lt;br /&gt;        If (Me.Comparator.compareAscDesc(checkValue, elem, Me.p_isCollReversed) = 0) Then Return ListTag(elem)&lt;br /&gt;    End ForAll&lt;br /&gt;End Function

classes.codesample:
%REM
The following code filters out values that are odd numbers
%END REM
Class EvenFilter as MapFilter
    Function filter(kvPair as Pair) as Boolean
        Dim value as Integer
        value = kvPair.value
        Return value Mod 2 = 0
    End Function
End Class
Dim map as New Map(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False)
Dim ef as New EvenFilter
Dim map2 as Map
Call map.put(&quot;Elem1&quot;, 1)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem2&quot;, 2)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem3&quot;, 3)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem4&quot;, 4)
Set map2 = map.filter(ef)
Print map2.elementCount

methods.label: removeByValue
methods.comment: Removes a value or values from the Map
methods.codesample:
Dim map as New Map(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False)
Dim comparator as MatchingDataTypeComparator
Call map.put(&quot;Elem1&quot;, 1)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem2&quot;, 2)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem3&quot;, 2)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem4&quot;, 4)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem3&quot;, 2)
Call map.removeByValue(2, False, comparator)
Print map.elementCount       &apos; Prints 4
Call map.removeByValue(2, True, comparator)
Print map.elementCount       &apos; Prints 2

methods.label: toJson
methods.comment: Converts the Map to a JsonObject. If the values are objects, the code will try to call a toJson method on the object, otherwise skip them.
methods.codesample:
Dim map as New Map(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False)
Dim jsonObj as jsonObject
Call map.put(&quot;Elem1&quot;, 1)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem2&quot;, 2)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem3&quot;, 3)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem4&quot;, 4)
Set jsonObj = map.toJson()
Print jsonObj.toString(false)       &apos; Prints {&quot;Elem1&quot;:1,&quot;Elem2&quot;:2,&quot;Elem3&quot;:3,&quot;Elem4&quot;:4}

methods.label: clear
methods.comment: Removes all keys and values from the Map and resets whether the keyset is reversed.
methods.codesample:
Dim map as New Map(&quot;STRING&quot;,Nothing,False)
Call map.put(&quot;Hello&quot;,&quot;World&quot;)
Print map.hasContent    &apos; Prints True
Call map.clear()
Print map.hasContent    &apos; Prints False

methods.label: fromJson
methods.comment: Loads a JsonObject that contains an object of scalars into the Map
methods.codesample:
Dim map as New Map(&quot;SCALAR&quot;, Nothing, False)
Dim parser as New JsonParser()
Call parser.loadFromJson(|{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42}|)
Call map.fromJson(parser.getRootObject())

methods.label: lock
methods.comment: Locks the map, so any put, remove, replace or reverse fiunctions trigger errors. Useful when passing a Map to other functions.
methods.codesample:
%REM

methods.label: transform
methods.comment: Transforms members of this Map usig a MapTransformer and adds them to the new Map passed.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code swaps key and value over
%END REM
Class SwapTransformer as MapTransformer
    Function transform(kvPair as Pair) as Pair
        Return new pair(kvPair.value, kvPair.key)
    End Function
End Class
Dim map as New Map(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False)
Dim map2 as New Map(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False)
Dim transformer as New SwapTransformer()
Call map.put(&quot;Elem1&quot;, 1)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem2&quot;, 2)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem3&quot;, 3)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem4&quot;, 4)
Call map.transform(transformer, map2)
Print CStr(map2.getNthKeyRaw(0))      &apos; Prints 1

methods.label: unlock
methods.comment: Unlocks the Map, so put, remove, replace and reverse functions can be used again
methods.codesample:
Dim map as New Map(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem1&quot;, 1)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem2&quot;, 2)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem3&quot;, 3)
Call map.lock()
Try
    Call map.put(&quot;Elem4&quot;, 4)
Catch
    If Err = 403 Then Print &quot;Map was locked&quot;
End Try
Call map.unlock()
Call map.put(&quot;Elem4&quot;, 4)    &apos; Successful

classes.comment: Class for filtering elements when filtering a Map
classes.codesample:
%REM
The following code filters out values that are odd numbers
%END REM
Class EvenFilter as MapFilter
    Function filter(kvPair as Pair) as Boolean
        Dim value as Integer
        value = kvPair.value
        Return value Mod 2 = 0
    End Function
End Class
Dim map as New Map(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False)
Dim ef as New EvenFilter
Dim map2 as Map
Call map.put(&quot;Elem1&quot;, 1)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem2&quot;, 2)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem3&quot;, 3)
Call map.put(&quot;Elem4&quot;, 4)
Set map2 = map.filter(ef)
Print map2.elementCount

%REM

    Function transform(kvPair as Pair) as Boolean

        Set person = kvPair.value

        Return new Pair(kvPair, person)
    End Function
End Class
Dim map1 as New Map(&quot;PERSON&quot;, Nothing, False)

Dim incrementer as New AgeIncrementer()
&apos;Populate map1
Call map1.transform(incrementer, map2)
